column5: Well, it's time to hop in the boat and start searching for the hyyyyuge fall walleyes. Today we are heading up the Rainy River in search of a few new spots we have mapped out, should be alot of fun!  It's 0 degrees outside with a steady 15kmh wind from the west. Last few days we've had lots of rain and bad weather, so I figure today is gonna be a perfect day.  Plan is to jig some minnows at the start, find the bites, then throw/troll some Rapala DT 10's.  I'll be back this evening with some pics and a report  Wish us luck, today is the first day in the search of the 15lb walleye
Good luck! I'm looking forward to seeing what you get.
Can't wait to see the pics!

just got back from round one, and the mommas are biting! I lost the biggest eye I've ever seen in person, lol, right at the fackin boat two. It was an easy 15lbs, if not a lil' more.  So, we came in for a bite to eat, then out we go again to see if we can find that lunker.  also caught 5-6 around 27-29", not monsters, but beautiful fish
Also, if any locals decide they want to go out, dont use a small boat, and wear your life jackets! 6ft waves, not fun in a 17ft with a 20 horse johnson
cant wait to see the pics. Ive never see a walleye bigger tha 10lbs. also i was gonna say something about the above post but i've matured a bit in the last few months
Good luck.....i just got back...loads of fish...all titchy little guys....i'd brought some trolling baits....but the wind and rain made me run for cover...stayed shallowish.

oh my boys and gals, do I have pics for you!  15 .5", 12.5, 12, 10.75, 10, 9.5. 8.5 and an 8lber  absolutely awesome!  Heading out in the morning with a few americans to try and repeat, pics tomorrow  FYI, big fish was 36"
This is starting to feel like a tease...bring on the big eye pics PLEASE
It is a tease, lol.  I'm just about to head back out, then a full report and pics will be posted
I'm jealous already and aint seen a pic yet....lol
here is a tease before I head out.  Small fish of the day, 25"  lol
this is what a 15lb walleye on your line looks like! (hahaha, a true tease)
If that's the small one....let me guess, there's actually a worm harness at the end of that anchor rope?
quick tip, salted tubes rigged on jig heads
